summary.long: Lamentations is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text:
How lonely sits the city
    that once was full of people!
How like a widow she has become,
    she that was great among the nations!
She that was a princess among the provinces
    has become subject to forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
From daughter Zion has departed
    all her majesty.
Her princes have become like stags
    that find no pasture;
they fled without strength
    before the pursuer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem remembers all the precious things
    that were hers in days of old.
When her people fell into the hand of the enemy
    and there was no one to help her,
the enemy looked on;
    they mocked over her downfall.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Enemies have stretched out their hands
    over all her precious things;
she has even seen the nations
    invade her sanctuary,
those whom you forbade
    to enter your congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All her people groan
    as they search for bread;
they trade their treasures for food
    to revive their lives.
Look, O Lord, and see
    how worthless I have become.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it nothing to you, all you who pass by?
    Look and see
if there is any sorrow like my sorrow,
    which was brought upon me,
which the Lord inflicted
    on the day of his fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I called to my lovers,
    but they deceived me;
my priests and elders
    perished in the city
while seeking food
    to revive their lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They heard how I was groaning,
    with no one to comfort me.
All my enemies heard of my trouble;
    they are glad that you have done it.
Bring on the day that you have announced,
    and let them be as I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How the Lord in his anger
    has humiliated daughter Zion!
He has thrown down from heaven to earth
    the splendor of Israel;
he has not remembered his footstool
    in the day of his anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has become like an enemy;
    he has destroyed Israel.
He has destroyed all its palaces,
    laid in ruins its strongholds,
and multiplied in daughter Judah
    mourning and lamentation.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They cry to their mothers,
    “Where is bread and wine?”
as they faint like the wounded
    in the streets of the city,
as their life is poured out
    on their mothers’ bosoms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What can I say for you, to what compare you,
    O daughter Jerusalem?
To what can I liken you, that I may comfort you,
    O virgin daughter Zion?
For vast as the sea is your ruin;
    who can heal you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your prophets have seen for you
    false and deceptive visions;
they have not exposed your iniquity
    to restore your fortunes
but have seen oracles for you
    that are false and misleading.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who pass along the way
    clap their hands at you;
they hiss and wag their heads
    at daughter Jerusalem:
“Is this the city that was called
    the perfection of beauty,
    the joy of all the earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Cry aloud to the Lord!
    O wall of daughter Zion!
Let tears stream down like a torrent
    day and night!
Give yourself no rest,
    your eyes no respite!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arise, cry out in the night,
    at the beginning of the watches!
Pour out your heart like water
    before the presence of the Lord!
Lift your hands to him
    for the lives of your children,
who faint for hunger
    at the head of every street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, O Lord, and consider!
    To whom have you done this?
Should women eat their offspring,
    the children they have borne?
Should priest and prophet be killed
    in the sanctuary of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I am one who has seen affliction
    under the rod of God’s wrath;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has driven and brought me
    into darkness without any light;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
against me alone he turns his hand,
    again and again, all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has made my flesh and my skin waste away;
    he has broken my bones;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has besieged and enveloped me
    with bitterness and tribulation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has made me sit in darkness
    like the dead of long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has walled me about so that I cannot escape;
    he has put heavy chains on me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though I call and cry for help,
    he shuts out my prayer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has blocked my ways with hewn stones;
    he has made my paths crooked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is a bear lying in wait for me,
    a lion in hiding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he led me off my way and tore me to pieces;
    he has made me desolate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he bent his bow and set me
    as a mark for his arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shot into my vitals
    the arrows of his quiver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have become the laughingstock of all my people,
    the object of their taunt songs all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has filled me with bitterness;
    he has sated me with wormwood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has made my teeth grind on gravel;
    he has made me cower in ashes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my soul is bereft of peace;
    I have forgotten what happiness is;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so I say, “Gone is my glory
    and all that I had hoped for from the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The thought of my affliction and my homelessness
    is wormwood and gall!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul continually thinks of it
    and is bowed down within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But this I call to mind,
    and therefore I have hope:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The steadfast love of the Lord never ceases,
    his mercies never come to an end;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they are new every morning;
    great is your faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord is my portion,” says my soul,
    “therefore I will hope in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is good to those who wait for him,
    to the soul that seeks him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good that one should wait quietly
    for the salvation of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good for one to bear
    the yoke in youth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to sit alone in silence
    when the Lord has imposed it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to put one’s mouth to the dust
    (there may yet be hope),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to give one’s cheek to the smiter
    and be filled with insults.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will not
    reject forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Although he causes grief, he will have compassion
    according to the abundance of his steadfast love;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he does not willingly afflict
    or grieve anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When all the prisoners of the land
    are crushed under foot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when justice is perverted
    in the presence of the Most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when one’s case is subverted—
    does the Lord not see it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can command and have it done,
    if the Lord has not ordained it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it not from the mouth of the Most High
    that evil and good come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should any who draw breath complain
    about the punishment of their sins?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us test and examine our ways
    and return to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us lift up our hearts as well as our hands
    to God in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have transgressed and rebelled,
    and you have not forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have wrapped yourself with anger and pursued us,
    killing without pity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you have wrapped yourself with a cloud
    so that no prayer can pass through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us filth and rubbish
    among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All our enemies
    have opened their mouths against us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
panic and pitfall have come upon us,
    devastation and destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes flow with rivers of tears
    because of the destruction of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes will flow without ceasing,
    without respite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until the Lord from heaven
    looks down and sees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My eyes cause me grief
    at the fate of all the young women in my city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who were my enemies without cause
    have hunted me like a bird;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they flung me alive into a pit
    and hurled stones on me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
water closed over my head;
    I said, “I am lost.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I called on your name, O Lord,
    from the depths of the pit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you heard my plea, “Do not close your ear
    to my cry for help, but give me relief!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You came near when I called on you;
    you said, “Do not fear!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have taken up my cause, O Lord;
    you have redeemed my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have seen the wrong done to me, O Lord;
    judge my cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have seen all their malice,
    all their plots against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have heard their taunts, O Lord,
    all their plots against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The whispers and murmurs of my assailants
    are against me all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whether they sit or rise—see,
    I am the object of their taunt songs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pay them back for their deeds, O Lord,
    according to the work of their hands!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give them anguish of heart;
    your curse be on them!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pursue them in anger and destroy them
    from under the Lord’s heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How the gold has grown dim;
    how the pure gold is changed!
The sacred stones lie scattered
    at the head of every street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The precious children of Zion,
    worth their weight in fine gold—
how they are reckoned as earthen pots,
    the work of a potter’s hands!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the jackals offer the breast
    and nurse their young,
but my people has become cruel,
    like the ostriches in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the infant sticks
    to the roof of its mouth for thirst;
the children beg for food,
    but there is nothing for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who feasted on delicacies
    perish in the streets;
those who were brought up in purple
    cling to ash heaps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the chastisement of my people has been greater
    than the punishment of Sodom,
which was overthrown in a moment,
    though no hand was laid on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her princes were purer than snow,
    whiter than milk;
their bodies were more ruddy than coral,
    their form cut like sapphire.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Happier were those pierced by the sword
    than those pierced by hunger,
whose life drains away, deprived
    of the produce of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hands of compassionate women
    have boiled their own children;
they became their food
    in the destruction of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord gave full vent to his wrath;
    he poured out his hot anger
and kindled a fire in Zion
    that consumed its foundations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of the earth did not believe,
    nor did any of the inhabitants of the world,
that foe or enemy could enter
    the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was for the sins of her prophets
    and the iniquities of her priests,
who shed the blood of the righteous
    in her midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blindly they wandered through the streets,
    so defiled with blood
that no one was able
    to touch their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Our eyes failed, ever watching
    vainly for help;
we were watching eagerly
    for a nation that could not save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They dogged our steps
    so that we could not walk in our streets;
our end drew near; our days were numbered,
    for our end had come.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord’s anointed, the breath of our life,
    was taken in their pits—
the one of whom we said, “Under his shadow
    we shall live among the nations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, O Lord, what has befallen us;
    look, and see our disgrace!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers,
    our homes to aliens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have become orphans, fatherless;
    our mothers are like widows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We must pay for the water we drink;
    the wood we get must be bought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With a yoke on our necks we are hard driven;
    we are weary; we are given no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have made a pact with Egypt and Assyria
    to get enough bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our ancestors sinned; they are no more,
    and we bear their iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Slaves rule over us;
    there is no one to deliver us from their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We get our bread at the peril of our lives,
    because of the sword in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our skin is black as an oven
    from the scorching heat of famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Women are raped in Zion,
    young women in the towns of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Princes are hung up by their hands;
    no respect is shown to the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Young men are compelled to grind,
    and boys stagger under loads of wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The old men have left the city gate,
    the young men their music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The joy of our hearts has ceased;
    our dancing has been turned to mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crown has fallen from our head;
    woe to us, for we have sinned!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because of this our hearts are sick;
    because of these things our eyes have grown dim:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because of Mount Zion, which lies desolate;
    jackals prowl over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O Lord, reign forever;
    your throne endures to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why have you forgotten us completely?
    Why have you forsaken us these many days?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore us to yourself, O Lord, that we may be restored;
    renew our days as of old—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
unless you have utterly rejected us
    and are angry with us beyond measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator
